content.description:
When a <math alttext="0.64 gram" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>0.64</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi></math> sample of <math alttext="C a C 2, solid " overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi>CaC</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>s</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> (molar mass <math alttext="64 grams per mole" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>64</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi><mo>/</mo><mi>mol</mi></math>) is added to <math alttext="100, decimal point, milliliters" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>100</mn><mtext>.</mtext><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>mL</mi></math> of water at <math alttext="25 degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>25</mn><mo rspace="0em">°</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math> in a calorimeter, all of the <math alttext="C a C 2, solid" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi>CaC</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>s</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> reacts with water as represented by the equation.

<math alttext="C a C 2, solid, plus 2 H 2 O, liquid, react to produce C 2 H 2, gas, plus Ca O H 2, solid, and delta H naught equals negative 128 kilojoules per mole sub reaction" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi>CaC</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>→</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mtext>Ca(OH)</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mspace width="1.00em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>H</mi><mo mathvariant="italic">°</mo><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>128</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>kJ</mi><mo>/</mo><msub><mi>mol</mi><mi>rxn</mi></msub></math>
content.question: Which of the following is true of the reaction system when <math alttext="0.64 gram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.64</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi></math> of <math alttext="C a C 2, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>CaC</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>s</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> reacts?

choices.label: <math alttext="1.3 kilojoules" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.3</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>kJ</mi></math> of energy is absorbed.
<math alttext="1.3 kilojules" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.3</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>kJ</mi></math> of energy is released.
<math alttext="82 kilojoules" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>82</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>kJ</mi></math> of energy is absorbed.
<math alttext="82 kilojoules" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>82</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>kJ</mi></math> of energy is released.

content.answer: <math alttext="1.3 kilojules" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.3</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>kJ</mi></math> of energy is released.

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
